entry.title: Here‚Äôs How Much Bitcoin Would Flood The Market If All Governments Decide To Sell
entry.summary:
The German government undoubtedly left a sour taste on the crypto market following the sale of nearly 50,000 BTC, which it seized from the pirated movie website movie2k. This has led to further research into how much Bitcoin other governments hold, given the impact their sales could have on the market if they also decided to sell.¬†
How Much Bitcoin Will Flood The Market If All Governments Sell
According to data from Bitcoin Treasuries, almost 517,414 BTC ($32.9 billion) will flood the market if all the nine governments currently holding the flagship crypto decide to offload all their BTC reserves. These governments include the United States, China, the United Kingdom, Ukraine, El Salvador, Bhutan, Venezuela, Finland, and Georgia.¬†
The United States government currently holds the mo‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ripple Targets US Senator: Guess How Much The Company Shelled Out For Her Ouster?
entry.summary:
In a big political move, John Deaton is challenging senior Massachusetts Senator Elizabeth Warren, with a $1 million gift from blockchain company Ripple. This demonstrates the seriousness of the animosity between the lawmaker and Deaton.
Ripple Launches Major Offensive
Ripple‚Äôs most recent offensive in its continuous conflict with well-known critic of the cryptocurrency industry, Senator Warren, comes in the form of donation to the Commonwealth Unity Fund super PAC. Warren has been vocal critic of digital currencies, regularly alerting readers about their possible dangers to the financial system and consumers.

entry.title: Ripple And Long-Term Partner Tranglo Break Up, What Happened?
entry.summary:
Ripple Labs has reportedly divested its stake in Tranglo, a Malaysia-based payment firm that leverages XRP for international transactions. This development was first brought to light by Crypto Eri, a prominent member of the XRP community, in a post on X from Monday, citing updates from Crunchbase.
Why Are Ripple And Tranglo Parting Ways?
Crunchbase‚Äôs latest records indicate that Ripple has exited investments in both the Bitstamp exchange and Tranglo. While the firm‚Äôs exit from Bitstamp appears aligned with Bitstamp‚Äôs acquisition by Robinhood, the divestment from Tranglo comes unexpectedly.
Tranglo has been an integral part of Ripple‚Äôs strategy to enhance global financial transactions using XRP. By leveraging the On-Demand Liquidity (ODL) service, Tranglo facilitated quicker and cheap‚Ä¶

entry.title: Mainstream Media Bias Is Bad, But Will Only Get Worse From This Point On
entry.summary: I logged back on to social media after a week offline in the countryside, only to see my timeline filled with news of an assassination attempt on Trump. My first thought, after noting my impeccable timing, was: ‚ÄúLet me see how CNN frames this.‚Äù And lo and behold: The first thing they wrote was that ‚ÄúTrump was rushed off stage after falling at his rally‚Äù. You may have had a similar thought process like mine, and if you did, you‚Äôll probably agree that the media landscape has changed. A lot. Influenced by the political leanings of its workforce, the rise of cancel culture, and the need to make money, this shift has majorly impacted how tech and Bitcoin (and pretty much everything else) are viewed. So what's going on here? Let's dive into what's shaping today's media. No Monolithic Media Eli‚Ä¶

entry.title: Craig Wright Referred To UK Prosecutors For Alleged Perjury In Bitcoin Authorship Case
entry.summary:
The Bitcoin authorship saga continues after a UK judge directed Craig Wright‚Äôs case to British prosecutors for alleged perjury and forgery of documents. The direction follows the latest ruling in the legal battle between the Australian computer scientist and the Crypto Open Patent Alliance (COPA).
COPA Vs. Wright Bitcoin Authorship Case
Over the years, Craig Wright has faced several legal battles for his attempts to copyright Bitcoin‚Äôs whitepaper and claim BTC‚Äôs authorship. His claim to be the person behind the pseudonym identity of Satoshi Nakamoto began in 2016 and has been highly contested by the crypto industry and its figures.
In the latest attempt to disprove the Australian computer scientist‚Äôs authorship of the flagship cryptocurrency, COPA took Wright to court in the UK. Pe‚Ä¶

entry.title: What's the Meta? Meet the Solana Dev Who Suffered Third Degree Burns to Pump a Token
entry.summary:
Meet Mikol: the Dare dev that doused himself in isopropyl alcohol and had fireworks shot at him. He instantly went up in flames and was rushed to hospital, where it became apparent he suffered third degree burns.
In this episode, Mikol reflects on the biggest night of his life, details his injuries, and the grueling recovery process he‚Äôs still in. Despite the traumatic incident, Mikol isn‚Äôt done with the project. Instead, he‚Äôs planning to build a decentralized app where community members can take on dares in exchange for DARE tokens.

entry.summary: BTC hits $54k, set for worst week in over year. Mt. Gox begins to move BTC & make distributions. German government continues to sell holdings. Worst day for BTC liquidations since FTX. Justin Sun says he is willing to buy German BTC. German MP calls on it to stop selling BTC. $52k super-trend support line eyed for BTC. Funding rates turn extremely negative across majors. Only 6 mining machines profitable below $56k. Coinbase spot buyers emerge to counter drop. Total3 hits RSI lows only hit 4 times in last 4 years. Fear & Greed index hits lowest since Jan 2023. Capo remains bullish. Real selling begins at $38k: Schiff. Coinbase continue to fight for Gensler‚Äôs emails. Circle mints $250m USDC on SOL. Symbiotic hits $1bn TVL. Taiwan Mobile may open crypto exchange. Unisat completes funding round with Binance.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 151 - BTC TAPS THE 60K LINE
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: -$14m. BTC drops to $60k, CME gap filed again. $1bn shorts liquidated if we rally to $62.6k. Pump(.)fun surpasses ETH for revenue. ETH will outperform BTC after ETF launch: K33. ETH ETF may be delayed even further. BTC heading to $150k: Fundstrat. Chainlink & Fidelity partner for fund data on-chain. USDC protects the dollar: Circle ad. Robinhood considers crypto futures in US & EU. Another BTC miner looks to IPO in US. Vitalik bullish on prediction markets. Sentient Labs raises $85m for AI on SOL. Mantra to tokenise $500m of real estate. TAO falls 15% after security breach. Crypto scams & hacks hit $572m in Q2.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 150 - BILLY TO A BILLY?
entry.summary: BTC ETF inflows hit highest in a month. ETH ETF inflows to hit $5bn in 6 months: Gemini. ETH public funds see largest outflow since 2022. SOL hits new ATH for monthly economic value. Sellers starting to look exhausted: Crypto Quant. Silvergate sued by SEC, settles for $63m. Circle gets stablecoin license for USDC in EU. US DoJ ironically chooses Coinbase for custody. Bitcoin miner aims for $16bn IPO. Bitfarms increases BTC mining amid takeover attempt. DOT has 2 year runway amid large burn. DOT ecosystem builders turn against team. PENDLE TVL falls $3bn as restaking rewards end. PayPal stablecoin goes live on Jupiter. At least $600m altcoin unlocks this month.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 149 - LUCA NETZ LIVE!
entry.summary: BTC bounces back above $61k after nosedive. SOL leads majors, BTC dominance falls. BTC RSI hit 18, largest net selling day in over a year. $174m ETF outflow led by GBTC. German government sells $24m more more BTC. Mt Gox info probably ‚Äòleaked to insiders‚Äô. Mr 100 buys dip for first time in 34 days. SOL leads Moonpay transactions for 5th week. Trump may speak at Bitcoin Nashville. Biden rehires crypto advisor. Crypto & AI complement each other: Balaji. Bitcoin will protect AI‚Äôs wealth: Pomp. Tether stops minting on Algorand & EOS. Jupiter launches v3 swaps. ETH Foundation mailing list gets leaked. Jump CEO resigns after CFTC investigation. 54% of Japanese institutional investors want BTC. Strike launches in UK. MiCA approved EUR stablecoins coming in 6 days.

entry.title: Transhumanism and the Quest for Immortality with SingularityNET CEO Dr. Ben Goertzel
entry.summary: Transhumanism is a philosophical and intellectual movement that advocates the enhancement of the human condition using technologies that can increase longevity, cognition, and well-being. In this interview, SingularityNET founder and CEO Dr. Ben Goertzel discusses his background in the transhumanist movement and how AI, and AGI will play a part.

entry.title: Vivendi Web3 Lead: 'There's No Ethical GenAI if You Don't Protect Content'
entry.summary: Fabien Aufrechter, VP of Web 3.0 at Vivendi, joined Rug Radio's Farokh aboard the Joker Odyssey at Cannes Lions to discuss the media group's plans for a global digital copyright, and how token-gated media will lead to the end of third-party cookies.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 148 - SOL ETF NARRATIVE DOMINATES
entry.summary: SOL leads majors as Van Eck files for ETF. Bitwise hints at SOL ETF filing. SOL will get ETF, ADA & XRP won‚Äôt: GSR. SOL price may rise 8.9x with ETF: GSR. Coinbase & Stripe team up for onboarding. BTC miner sell pressure weakens. BTC activity drops to lowest level in 10 years. Steve Cohen shuts down crypto arm of hedge fund. Crypto unmentioned in Presidential debate. Kraken co-founder donates $1m to Trump. Bolivia lifts BTC ban. MegaLabs raises $20m, aims for 100k TPS.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 147 - THE BLAST FALLOUT
entry.summary: Crypto bounces, ETFs see another small net inflow. The US government sends 3940 BTC to exchanges. Spot ETH ETFs may be coming July 4th. Coinbase sues SEC over FOIA inquiries. Most ‚Äòobvious & attractive‚Äô buying opp possible. US man convicted of home invasions to steal BTC. Blast launches at $2.5bn FDV, disappoints many. ADA faces DDoS attacks with 200 transactions. Losses from deep fakes could hit $24bn in 2024. Miners face M&A boom on AI retrofitting. Marathon mines $16M KAS. Vitalik introduces ZK voting company Rarimo. Animoca Brands considers public listing.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 146 - IT'S BLAST DAY!
entry.summary: BTC ETFs reverse 7-day outflow. Geverman government to sell $35m more BTC. SOL Blinks allows transactions from any website. Jupiter allows you to swap tokens from X. Helius allows SOL staking from X. Drift allows you to leverage trade from X. ETH supply increases for 73 days straight. ETF review going smoothly: Gensler. Expect $15bn net inflows for ETH ETF: Bitwise. VanEck to waive ETH ETF fee until 2025. UAE new regulations could limit stablecoins. Court convicts two men for crypto ‚Äòsecurities fraud‚Äô. BTC ETFs to be approved by Morgan Stanley. Vanguard CEO calls BTC ‚Äòa stable asset like gold‚Äô. Blast launches today, 16.5% as community airdrop. $2.9bn FDV for Blast on Aevo, others predict higher. Top Blast holders to see vesting over 6 months. Nubank to integrate Bitcoin Lightning Network. FTX creditors to vote on cash or crypto repayment.

German government sells $24m more more BTC. Mt Gox info probably ‚Äòleaked to insiders‚Äô. Mr 100 buys dip for first time in 34 days. SOL leads Moonpay transactions for 5th week. Trump may speak at Bitcoin Nashville. Biden rehires crypto advisor. Crypto & AI complement each other: Balaji. Bitcoin will protect AI‚Äôs wealth: Pomp. Tether stops minting on Algorand & EOS. Jupiter launches v3 swaps. ETH Foundation mailing list gets leaked. Jump CEO resigns after CFTC investigation. 54% of Japanese institutional investors want BTC. Strike launches in UK. MiCA approved EUR stablecoins coming in 6 days.

entry.title: Mika Shares How to Send and Receive Crypto Using Kraken Wallet
entry.summary: Join Rug Radio creator and crypto influencer Mika as she guides you through the process of sending and receiving cryptocurrency using the Kraken wallet.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 144 - A VERY RED DAY
entry.summary: BTC hits 6-week lows, $215m liquidations in fall. Mt Gox set to start BTC repayments in July. Fear & Greed index nears 2024 lows. Bitfinex whales‚Äô long positioning rebounds. Open Interest rises as shorts grow, funding negative. BTC is economic immortality, going to $10m: Saylor. Moment of truth for BTC to rebound: Ansem. Expect $61-62k BTC to hold: Emperor BTC. SOL upgrade is big step-change: Raoul Pal. Expect slow melt-up from ETH ETF: DC Investor. MKR falls 11% as delegate gets phished. TON ecosystem sees phishing attacks spread.
